content:
Check:
  all:
    #Restrict check to records where --STDTC has a complete date and RFSTDTC has a complete date
    - any:
        - name: --STDTC
          operator: is_complete_date
        - name: RFSTDTC
          operator: is_complete_date
    #Check --STDY derivation
    - name: --STDY
      operator: equal_to
      value: $val_stdy
Operations:
  - name: RFSTDTC
    operator: dy
    domain: DM
    id: $val_stdy
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0220
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Study day must be calculated using the algorithm detailed in the SDTMIG.
Outcome:
  Message: --STDY is not properly calculated per study day algorithm
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0220
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The permissible Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY,
                  and --ENDY) describe the relative day of the observation  starting
                  with the reference date as Day 1.  They are determined by comparing
                  the date portion of the respective date/time variables  (--DTC,
                  --STDTC, and --ENDTC) to the date portion of the Subject Reference
                  Start Date  (RFSTDTC from the Demographics domain). All Study Day
                  values are integers.  Thus, to calculate Study Day, --DY = (date
                  portion of --DTC) - (date portion of RFSTDTC) + 1 if --DTC is on
                  or after RFSTDTC,  --DY = (date portion of --DTC) - (date portion
                  of RFSTDTC) if --DTC precedes RFSTDTC.  This algorithm should be
                  used across all domains.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Section: 4.4.4
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Exclude:
      - DM
